label: 庄屋
本: Community and Commerce in Late Medieval Japan:  The Corporate Villages of Tokuchin-ho . Stanford University Press . 1992
説明文: The headman...represented the village vis-a-vis the lord and was accountable for the village's fulfillment of its state-ordered functions.  He was a mediator between the ruling institution and its subject population and was the chief vehicle for disseminating the lord's orders (p. 172).
